page.title: 05NEW SUPERSTORE IN WEST HULL
page.content: We were met by the supervisor who was to show us round the new superstore. First we saw shelves being checked and learned that the information would be fed into the computer for fast re-ordering to maintain an efficient service. Wearing special hats and following our noses we went into the bakery where we saw modern equipment making bread and cakes. We learned how to put jam into doughnuts and cream into buns. Next door the butchers were cutting, packing and labelling meat. Vegetables and fruit are stored in a "cold" room and wine behind locked doors. We watched as supplies were unloaded with the aid of a forklift. On our way out we caught sight of the enormous cake specially made for the stores first birthday.
